NavBlock.description: This is an overview of this course

Block.description: No text has been added yet.

This template includes the following sections:
  • Introduction: includes pages for course description (this page), syllabus, requirements, grading and professor, as well as announcements and a list of participants
  • Syllabus: includes blocks for adding a syllabus to the site and/or uploading a file containing a syllabus
  • Blog: includes a page for...

version.content:
This template includes the following sections:
  • Introduction: includes pages for course description (this page), syllabus, requirements, grading and professor, as well as announcements and a list of participants
  • Syllabus: includes blocks for adding a syllabus to the site and/or uploading a file containing a syllabus
  • Blog: includes a page for a course blog with lists of blog categories and recent posts
  • Assignments: includes pages for each week of the semester
  • Discussion: includes a page for discussion topics
  • Resources: a section for any number of pages for course resources
  • Wiki: a section where everyone can create new pages and links using wiki notation
(Any of the sections and pages in this site can be edited and deleted as needed... As well additional sections and pages can be added)

This template includes the following sections:
  • Introduction: includes pages for course description (this page), syllabus, requirements, grading and professor, as well as announcements and a list of participants
  • Syllabus: includes blocks for adding a syllabus to the site and/or uploading a file containing a syllabus
  • Blog: includes a page for a course blog with lists of blog categories and recent posts
  • Assignments: includes pages for each week of the semester
  • Discussion: includes a page for discussion topics
  • Resources: a section for any number of pages for course resources
  • Wiki: a section where everyone can create new pages and links using wiki notation
(Any of the sections and pages in this site can be edited and deleted as needed... As well additional sections and pages can be added)

Block.description: No text has been added yet.
No text has been added yet.

Links can be made to Segue content using wiki notation (e.g. [[title]]). For example, if you have a page on your Segue site with the title "Introduction" you can create a link to this page by enclosing its title in double square brackets (e.g. [[introduction]]).

...

version.content:
Links can be made to Segue content using wiki notation (e.g. [[title]]). For example, if you have a page on your Segue site with the title "Introduction" you can create a link to this page by enclosing its title in double square brackets (e.g. [[introduction]]).

Wiki links can be made to content blocks, pages and sections. Wiki links are not case-sensitive so [[overview]] will link to either a page/section/block whose title is "overview" or whose title is "Overview"

"Create Node" Wiki Links

If there is no content on your site that has a title which matches what is specified in the wiki link, then a special "create node" link will be created. A "create node" link looks like any other link except that it is followed by a question mark (e.g. [[new page]]). When a participant who has been given permission to add to the site clicks on this link, they will be given the opportunity to add a new page, section or content block (depending on the extent of their editing permissions).

These types of links are great for collaborative site creation, as well as "bottom up" organization. Simple start adding content to your site and use wiki links to content that you or others will add later.

Links can be made to Segue content using wiki notation (e.g. [[title]]). For example, if you have a page on your Segue site with the title "Introduction" you can create a link to this page by enclosing its title in double square brackets (e.g. [[introduction]]).

Wiki links can be made to content blocks, pages and sections. Wiki links are not case-sensitive so [[overview]] will link to either a page/section/block whose title is "overview" or whose title is "Overview"

"Create Node" Wiki Links

If there is no content on your site that has a title which matches what is specified in the wiki link, then a special "create node" link will be created. A "create node" link looks like any other link except that it is followed by a question mark (e.g. [[new page]]). When a participant who has been given permission to add to the site clicks on this link, they will be given the opportunity to add a new page, section or content block (depending on the extent of their editing permissions).

These types of links are great for collaborative site creation, as well as "bottom up" organization. Simple start adding content to your site and use wiki links to content that you or others will add later.
